Reviews.Title: “great little place!”
Reviews.Author: jilli_bean74
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for one night before a cruise. Check in and check out were a breeze, i booked online with itravel2000. It was so nice to be right on the beach. bed was comfortable after a long flight, breakfast was good, especially the coffee! And the front desk offered to store our bags for us after check out the next day so that we could enjoy san juan a bit before getting on the cruise. Even offered to let us use the staff sower if we wanted! we didnt.. But overall the hotel was clean and cute and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean, nice”
Reviews.Author: 56Flowergirl
Reviews.Content: The picture of lonely hotel on the beach is wrong...there is hotels and condos around Sandy Beach hotel..Small hotel good for over nighter before cruise or few nights to sleep if planing to go places from there..Bus stop around the corner and lots of places to to eat right there in main street..Have to say this..The people,front desk the most helpfull ever..you asked anything, extra pillows, towels,change for bus,were good places to eat and so ..there were to help..They make you feel like home..

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Imagined”
Reviews.Author: jazapsu
Reviews.Content: First, if you look at the picture of the hotel, you will realize that the building on the left has been eliminated. The hotel is close to but not ON the beach. Usually, I'm just happy with a clean room for the price. Not this time. I booked the Sandy Beach for pre- and post-cruise nights. The first night, I was in room 303. The bathroom sink had no plub, the towels were so threadbare that you could almost see through them, the shampoo containers had broken seals and were half full. The windows were filthy, there was sand on the floor, and the room smelled musty despite the window air conditioner. The final night, I was in room 102. No phone. When blowing the thick dust off of the clock/radio, I sneezed. No phone. The room is located right next to a common area where a party was going on until late at night. Since you can hear through the walls...enough said. To print out my boarding pass, I had to give all of my information to the desk clerk. A new printer had been installed, and the clerk didn't know how to use it at first. I left to have dinner, and when returning, the desk clerk said that he needed my information again. I did get the pass. Next time, I will pay the extra and stay at a hotel not billed as a "cozy bed and breakfast." That's a misnomer unless the definition of "cozy" means something different to different people.

Reviews.Title: “Form Your Own Opinion....”
Reviews.Author: Bluekrypton
Reviews.Content: I just stayed for 2 days at the Sandy Beach Hotel in San Juan. While it wasn't a Marriott or a Sheraton, it was everything I needed it to be. When I arrived at this hotel I was expecting the worst based on the advice of this page and much to my delight it really wasn't that bad. It's 30-50 ft from the beach, my room was clean and fairly spacious (shared a room with my parents) and was central to everything in the Condado Beach Zone. The staff was very friendly, however if I did have one gripe about the place is that the check in time is 3pm and we arrived at 8 am. The beds were comfortable and the room had a flat screen tv in it. The Moral of this story is if you want the Sheraton, pay for the Sheraton. A very basic hotel with the perfect location! The place had free wifi, and a very fresh continental breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Stay if you just need a bed”
Reviews.Author: SpenserFleming
Reviews.Content: Its not bad for the money considering the prices of the other hotels in Condado. It has decent beds and okay showers. The staff is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Sandy Beach Hotel maybe or not”
Reviews.Author: quigs57
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 10 steps from the beach next to the Marriott hotel. We were quoted a price and were presented with another when we got there. The first manager was helpful and nice. The room was furnished with 2 double beds, tile floor and need of remodeling. The towels were frayed and gray. They did give us towels for the beach. The TV was great as was the air conditioner. The breakfast was ok, coffee good. Codado Beach area is run down a bit but fun to walk through at night. Probably would stay there again for precruise but would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, just really close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: Anto4u
Reviews.Content: It was a little pricy compared to the space and the quality of the hotel. If you just want a place to sleep, go ahead. There is a bus running until 11.30pm from old San Juan to the hotel and fare is only $50!! Evelina the clerk is really really helpful though!

Reviews.Title: “I won't stay at Sand Beach Hotel again”
Reviews.Author: peacola
Reviews.Content: Check In: It took 30 minutes to check in. My Aunt booked the hotel through their website less than 2 hours before I arrived at the hotel. When she reserved it, it seemed as if she paid for it when in actuality she only reserved the room. Once I arrived the clerk said they needed to see my Aunts credit card, I explained to her she was not with me and had already paid for the room. That's when it was explained to me it was not paid for but reserved, and if the credit card is not present I could not check in. In order to take the credit card, my aunt would need to send in a fax with a copy of the front and back of her credit card as well as her driver’s license saying she authorized the payment. I explained she was not near a fax and is there any other way to pay for the room without having to do that maybe book through Travelocity. She said I could. I told them to cancel the current reservation so it could be re-booked through Travelocity. The clerk then explained because I’m rebooking without more than a 24 hours notice they would have to charge me a $79 cancelation fee. I explained to her I just made the original reservation online less than two hours ago, I’m standing right in front of you and I’m rebooking the same room why would you charge me $79. At this point I called my Aunt and passed the phone to the clerk so my Aunt could reason with her. In the end she said she would talk to the manager to see if he would waive the fee. Once that was partially settled, I was booked given and key and went to my room The Room: Once I entered the room I noticed a smell, but I couldn’t tell where it originated from. I thought maybe the humidity was causing a closed in smell. Once I pulled the sheets back I noticed they looked stained. I pulled the top sheet back and a section was covered in urine, the smell was horrible. It penetrated down to the mattress cover but not the mattress. I don’t see how the maid could have missed the smell or that spot when making up the bed. I called the front desk and asked for new sheets, they immediately brought them up and apologized profusely. The Restroom: The restroom is very small; the tile could use a good cleaning with bleach to remove dark stains. I also saw what looked like two small baby cockroaches on the toilet. Cleanliness: The maids did not actually clean the room, I marked my sheets to see if my sheets were changed, they were not. They did not clean the restroom, they only made the bed and replaced the towels. Strangely when I arrived I had only three large bath towels, no wash clothes and when they replaced the towels they only gave me three large bath towels. Luckily I had my own face towel, but I thought it was strange I was not provided one or at least a hand towel. Wi-Fi: I was told I would have Wi-Fi in my room, it is available, but it did not reach to the second floor. I had to go down to an area directly adjacent to the front desk to surf the net. I also tried getting a signal in the courtyard but I was unable to. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, the stained sheets alone would deter me from ever going back or telling anyone to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Sandy Beach -- very good choice”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBidnith
Reviews.Content: I spent my 1st 2 nights in PR at the Sandy Beach Hotel. The staff was helpful. The location is a short bus ride from Old San Juan and my kids loved the smashing waves on the beach right outside the hotel. Walk one block and you are on the main drag for the Condado section of San Juan. We walked a long distance checking out all the eating options (more to the left but the Subway and Wendys are to the right). Complimentary continental breakfast was an added bonus. The hotel is not a place where you want to spend the day, but as a jumping off point to see Old San Juan or other parts of PR it is great. If you have a rental car you may have a rough time finding parking (I didn't ask). But when I went to get my rental car to go to the awesome Camuy caves, I just parked out front for a few minutes. My 3 kids and I loved our trip and the 2 nights we spent at Sandy Beach were a great start. Now if I could just find that octopus necklace.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay for the money!”
Reviews.Author: ellaJ15
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I booked this hotel online for five nights! Based on the reviews we were not expecting much. However, our experience was nothing like some that were described. Our room was a bit small, but clean and well maintained. The breakfast provided was enough to get you started, and the food was fresh and tasteful. The staff was very helpful in helping us book tours and providing information about the area. The location was great and surrounded with many nice restaurants. I even liked the beach at this hotel. The waters were a little rough compared to other beaches in the area, but more exciting in my opinion. The other beaches were so calm they felt more like lakes. My only complaint would be that we had to ask for towels a few times because the housekeeper forgot to put them in our room. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Sandy Beach Hotel and would definitely stay there again. Although you have to consider the price your paying! Because If your getting a hotel for this reasonable there are some things that would be foolish to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: Coastiemommy
Reviews.Content: I am not a big traveler. I came to visit my son who is stationed in the coast guard here. It was just me and my 14 yr old son. I was nervous about vacationing with him. The staff was great they let my older son stay the first night at no charge and even gave us extra towels for the beach. The beach was only 50ft at worst from the hotel and they have a shower outside to get off the extra salt and sand. Taxis were outside the hotel at all times and cost about 15$ to go to almost anywhere. The breakfast could have been better with different choices of fruit and pastries each day, but overall ok for free. The location in san Juan is great but the area food is expensive. I spent $100 for a lunch for 3. This is the "rich" district so staying at a cheap hotel is the ONLY money you will save. If you stay here make sure not to put the housekeeping sign on the door the housekeeper thinks if it's out that no service is wanted so leave it off the door if you want clean sheets and towels.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty!”
Reviews.Author: Ashen15
Reviews.Content: Yes this is right on the beach (not one you'd probably spend much time at), and we were fortunate to find parking right in front of the hotel's side street (we were not told about available hotel parking, which was full). The room was small and dirty. The bed was extremely uncomfortable. Thankfully our cellphones held enough charge for our alarms to go off, because we did not receive our requested wake up call.

Reviews.Title: “Right on nice beach but don't expect a lot. recommend? maybe...”
Reviews.Author: familyguyof6
Reviews.Content: The rooms are sized ok. Cleaniness is the worst part. We had to request clean sheets and a second towel. The staff were accomidating and flexible however. I would not recommend a extended stay. We used it as a overnight before a cruise which worked out ok. I noticed the website mentions an indoor pool, there is not. It is a very small hotel in an area that has nice hotels surrounded by gutted and rundown ones. To their credit, they appear to be trying to improve their image. Note that all the cabs did not know it by name (they knew it as a different hotel). In short, I might use it again in a pinch (price is right) but warn all your travelers first. If you are at all fussy, move on to something else. It has that third world country feel to it.

Reviews.Title: “When you aren't paying for five stay quality, don't expect it.”
Reviews.Author: RickyB
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from January 13th - 15th. Was way too late for booking a hotel in Old San Juan so that we wouldn't have to drive or pay expensive taxi rates to go to Las Fiestas de la Calle San Sebastián, the Carnival in Old San Juan. Fortunately, Sandy Beach had an opening for a quadruple room. Plus tax, we each paid $60 for a two night stay... which is reasonable considering the taxi to the area where we live would pretty much be the same and much more of a hassle. It's a small hotel, no frills. It's true what they say about the elevator, too many people and you might break a toe when stepping out of it (it wont be level with the floor). The room had the essentials, we bought water across the street at Wallgreen's and kept in the room for emergencies (no fridge or anything of that sort in the room). Flaw: service. We had a quadruple room but it only brought 2 towels... asked for two more and it took two hours and a few calls for them to actually bring them. Would I stay here again? Yeah. Again, if you aren't paying for five star quality, don't expect it. You get what you pay for, and a bit more considering it's in such a great spot in the heart of Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Location Not The Hotel :(”
Reviews.Author: gemini52957
Reviews.Content: My Stay Was 12/7-12-9-2010 OMG!! I thought I Was Going To Get The Same Staff & Service From The Canario From The Sea!! " NOT" Ivelisse Is Extremely Hostile That's The Idiot That Booked Me & Charged Me For The In Room Safe Key When I Returned & Signed a Receipt $56.00 Unbelievable, I arrived Early, Not Even a Good Morning, " JU Is Early, No Cannot Register Unteel 3:00!!! What I was told On The Phone after sending 5 Freakin emails No reply, 11:00 Am Check-in. I had to place My suit case in a Storage unit & head To The Beach with all My Cash & Credit Cards, To Be Surrounded by Dominican Cab Drivers Cat Calls, A Short P,R. Man offering Massages With a Nasty Attitude When I Declined, UGH!!! The Room Listen Up Ms. Grouch Ivelisse is Not Ocean Front, My Dear!!! It's Ocean VIEW!!! There's a Huge Differerence. I Thank Axel The Male Receptionist For being Sooo Kind & People Skills Glad You Liked Your Tee Shirts You Deserved Them. I Said Good Bye To Condado Forever & Sandy Beach Hotel. If I Want to be treated Rudely I Can Stay In NEW YORK CITY FOR THAT. :( Exremely Dissapointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful local ambiance you won't find at large chain hotel!”
Reviews.Author: email4debby
Reviews.Content: We greatly enjoyed our stay at the El Canario Inn. It has such a wonderful local ambiance with colorful decor and a beautiful courtyard. Advertising does not exaggerate the closeness to beach, restaurants, shopping and sites. While the rooms are pretty basic, they were clean, air conditioned, had great TVs and hot showers. We traveled with a large group which can often be arduous. The communication and organization with hotel staff was excellent from our very first contact when making our reservations. Upon our arrival, they were so well organized that I don't believe check in has ever been easier anywhere we have traveled. An overall great value and a charming little place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location, that's all.”
Reviews.Author: Jeff19438
Reviews.Content: Terrific location, just on the beach. Nice view from the rooftop terrace. Local restaurants were fabulous. Rooms needed major updating, cosmetic repairs, new furniture. Water pressure/hot water was minimal' ask for more towels and insist upon it. Convenient/cheap offsite parking; I recommend renting a car as it is less expensive than using cabs, and more convenient than the buses. Parking in Old San Juan is so inexpensive at the parking garages. Tis place was not too clean, beeping icemaker all night long, and the breakfast was adequate, but boring. Great coffee. I like it better when it was owned by the El Canario group. The front desk people were mostly friendly.

Reviews.Title: “"What a dump"”
Reviews.Author: adonald291
Reviews.Content: As guests who have stayed in this hotel under the previous management, we booked our stay in May for eleven days and requested the same room which we had stayed in for the past ten years.We were very dissapointed when we arrived and were told that our room was not ready. We were put in another room which also was not cleaned. The room had dried blood stains on the floor, the shower had hair and other debris in it, towels were dirty and smelly , the mirrors and wall were dirty and the quilt on the bed had a big hole in it. We had to clean our own room in order to feel comfortable in it. The next day we were then given the room we originally requested however, there were no towels. When we complained to the hotel manager she told us she was only the secretary, apparently she was too embrassed or ashamed to admit that she was the manager, and said "these things happen and an early reservation does not guarantee a specific room " eventhough the it says in the computer " do not move guests from this room" .. Our reservation was made with the niece of the owner who was the one who noted that we were not to be moved from our requested room. Over the next ten days we had to clean our own room and change the linens and towels. The one maid they had came in when she felt like it or not at all, one day she showed up at 5 PM to start cleaning and only stayed for half an hour. There was garbage left in the halls, the ice machine was broken and kept beeping all night which kept you up along with the noisy air conditoners. The guide books that gives guests ideas as to where to go, and what to see were in the rooms but were dated from 2008, the current copies were hidden in the emergency stairwell and not even displayed in the lobby. Then you might not be able to read them while in the lobby because the front door was so salt encrusted I was surprised that any light filtered in from the outside. I could go on and on but there isn't enough space to tell you how disappointed we were with the place. It got to the point that we were recommending other hotels to guests who were about to check in. After hearing our horror story they fled. The only plus was the front desk staff who were plesant. If you want a pleasant experience while in San Juan avoid this dump at all costs. I would recommend looking at any of the other Canario hotels which this one used to be. To quote Betty Davis "WHAT A DUMP"

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: gittinsj
Reviews.Content: The hotel wasn't terrible. It just wasn't great, either. If you're looking for a place to stay, it might do. If you want to be right near the beach without paying excessive hotel prices, this may be for me. The rooms are rather small, especially if you want more than one bed. The room is very minimalistic, but does have a TV. There is no wireless internet. Parking will cost you, as it does elsewhere, but be careful. They have an agreement where it will be only $10 a night at a nearby parking lot, but there was a whole lot of confusion about how that worked. Ask and make sure you understand before you go and park if you need to. There is a continental breakfast, which was nice, but whoever set it up woke up very early and starting talking rather loudly. The rooms are not very well sound-proofed at all, and so I could hear everything, even when I didn't want to. Finally, the beds were not all that comfortable, but I did fall asleep in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing experience!”
Reviews.Author: brodycooper
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had booked onto a Princess cruise out of San Juan and needed a one-night stay in a hotel hoping to do some sight-seeing before boarding the ship the next day. I had booked one night on-line for Feb 6th 2 months ago secured with my Credit Card and confirmed by El Canario By the Sea. It looked like a very cute and cozy B&B right on the ocean and was very reasonable in price. Unfortunately our flight from Toronto was delayed due to storms in the U.S. causing us to miss our connection in Newark, and we arrived very late in San Juan at almost midnight. We were hot and tired and after a $25 taxi ride we arrived at El canario where we were told there was no room for us despite having the e-mail confirmation with us. There was no explanation for this and we were told we would be sent to another "sister" hotel called Coral By the Sea which was back at the airport area. They even wanted us to pay for the taxi ride again but we insisted they should pay the driver at the very least. Needless to say we were very angry and disappointed. The hotel they sent us to was in a very run-down area and looked terrible from the outside. There was no water pressure at all from the shower and the floors were uneven, there was not even a matress cover. You can be sure I searched high and low for signs of bedbugs. All in all a very unprofessional establishment - we were never even offered anything for our trouble and inconvenience. I would definitely not recommend this hotel to anyone as it seems they cannot be trusted to honour their e-mail confirmations. C.S. & J.B.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: PatMcS
Reviews.Content: I have been to Puerto Rico numerous times and will always go back. BUT I will never stay at an El Canario Inn. This practically ruined our trip. The price looked good for our budget this trip. Well, we got less than what we paid for! The elevator never stopped properly so you always had to watch your step. Our room was very small and has not been updated in 50 years! Drop ceiling that would flap up and down if we opened a window. Cracks in the wall. No hangers in the closet. Broken unusable safe. Beds not made properly, with sheets never changed, we knew this because there was always sand in our beds. Old tile floors never vaccumned. Tiny, tiny bathroom with no counter space and very weak shower pressure. A bag with new toiletries was taken! We had to ask for toilet paper everyday of our stay!!! I can go on but I won't...False advertising!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous facilities, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: jcozzone
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my parents and brother at El Canario by the Sea over Christmas. They had just opened a week before under new ownership. The hotel was old but inexpensive and well located. By old, I mean, ledges to step over when entering rooms, which my mother stubbed her toe on repeatedly, and a faulty elevator. When 3 people get in the elevator, it stops 3 inches below the landing. I gashed my toe open stepping out of the elevator on the ground floor, and the hotel didn't even have a first aid kit. My family had to go to Walgreens a block away themselves to buy first aid supplies while the receptionist watched. Needless to say, an open wound ruined the rest of my beach vacation... and not even a word of apology from the owner/manager., never mind offering to pay for the medical supplies or even my room. We were first told the owner didn't speak English, then that their insurance company said it would be an admission of guilt, which would be a problem in getting the elevator company to fix it. Not that we cared what they did to the elevator company. I just wish they had waited an extra week to make sure their facilities were up to scratch before opening. It wouldn't have ruined my vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal I Ever Had!”
Reviews.Author: Chadwickjames
Reviews.Content: El Canario by The Sea doesn't look like much when you go inside, but what it lacks in pizzazz it makes up for in price. The rooms are modest, but I didn't travel all the way to Puerto Rico to sit in my room all day! The beach is literally steps away and there are many shops and bars nearby. The staff was super friendly and the continental breakfast works wonder on even the most sinister hangovers. I am staying here again next year, and would recommend it to everyone. (Ok, not everyone, there are only 25 rooms or something:))

Reviews.Title: “Great Stop for a Pre-Cruise”
Reviews.Author: panamatiger
Reviews.Content: We really want to give this small family run hotel a good review. We booked the El Canario by the Sea as a pre-cruise day/night. The other reviews were slightly mixed but we gave The El Canario a try. You have to take a taxi from the airport to the hotel, and to the cruise ship, or into Old San Juan for the night. Since we wanted to just hang out at the beach, no problem. We knew that a head of time. The taxi stand is right outside the hotel. Right up the street at the next parallel intersection is the GreenHouse Cafe and the Latin Star. Great little places for dinner. Starbucks is also a block away. The hotel is a corner walk to the beach. All beaches in Puerto Rico are public and free. Its the same beach as the Marriot for 1/3rd the price. You cant see the beach from your room because the Hotel's neighbor is a condo complex but that doesnt matter. The room and hotel was very clean. The staff was very friendly. The room we had was about the size of a cruise ship cabin, so for one night it didn't matter. The A/C worked well and there were no insects. The elevator is an old style Otis with just enough room for two and your luggage. It's just a little tight. We had the continental breakfast befor catching our cruise ship.We recommend this for one or two days and be prepared for using taxis. We would stay there again Garry + Pauline Haworth Manchester, NH

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for your Money”
Reviews.Author: JASTA100
Reviews.Content: We checked this hotel on trip advisor prior to booking and there were only two bad reviews. We stayed there for one night prior to our Caribbean Cruise and then back for four more nights. The rooms need upgrading but are clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We wouldn't hesitate to stay there again and what more could you ask for, the beach was right there!!

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel in a Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Trav3lingFun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Canario by the Sea for 5 days from 2/13-2/18. It was a pleasant stay and it was close to a lot of restaurants, Starbucks, gas stations, a Walgreens and a quick bus ride to Old San Juan. The staff was really helpful, especially Jose, who gave us exact directions to get to Fajardo and El Yunque Rainforest. I have to admit, the rooms were pretty small (we got the superior double room), but it was clean and the maids were very efficient. (Just an FYI, if you are taller than 5'6, your knees would hit the wall when you are sitting in the bathroom...haha) The Condado area is a bit run down, but it's safe (or rather safer than most areas in PR) and convenient. If you are looking for a place to sleep, literally 10 steps to the beach, walking distance too many places, this no frills budget hotel is a good place. If you are one of those tourists that rather sit by a pool when the BEACH is right outside, you might want to stay cross the street at the Marriott and pay almost triple the amount each night.

Reviews.Title: “student trip”
Reviews.Author: donaprofe
Reviews.Content: I took a student group to the island several years ago. It was a wonderful experience! Accomodations were clean, yet modest, breakfast was sufficient, even for teens, and the beachside location was terrific for them as well. I hope to stay here again this year when we return with another school group.

Reviews.Title: “It's true...steps to the beach.”
Reviews.Author: nicolealia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at El Canario by The Sea Aug.22nd through Aug.26th. It is really literally steps to the beach. We had a room with 2 single beds on the top/3rd floor. In the hallway, out the window you can see the beach. Being so close was perfect because it rained on and off a few days we were there. Considering we were next to an expensive hotel I felt very lucky to share the same beach and pay the price we did. If you aren't big on extras this is the place for you. There was always hot water and the air conditioner worked, other than that you have a tv, a bed and a bathroom with shower (no tub). The staff were great, they recommended the best tour guide for El Yunque. He not only picked us up from the hotel, but also did the el mina trail AND he climbed up the waterfall, jumped in and helped anyone from our group who was willing to do so, do the same! I just booked reservations to go back this coming May 2009. Easy reservation process, quick response, no mix-ups. 100% satisfied and oh on the corner Walgreens and free bus to old san juan.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Overnight before a Cruise”
Reviews.Author: StickSister
Reviews.Content: We spent the night here before heading out on Carnival Destiny. Late arrival was fine and establishment was clean. For the money, it was ok but very spartan. Be aware that there was no hair dryer even in the office to borrow. It was one of the least expensive hotels we found. We were quite warm in our dorm-like, 2 single-beds room, which made it hard to sleep. Located in the pricey Condado region which seemed fairly safe but be advised that you will see pan handlers. Close to a WalGreens which was convenient. The complimentary continental breakfast was not anything special. The hotel is only steps away from the beach. Just depends on your needs and the price range you desire. Booked an over-night stay at the Coral Princess which was a palace in comparion upon return from our cruise. My review of that inn will be posted later.

Reviews.Title: “What A Dump”
Reviews.Author: lisama18
Reviews.Content: I kept reading great reviews. So I thought I would take a chance for one night. Big mistake. When I got there I was hugely disappointed. The place was dumpy. The elevator could barely fit a small child. The rooms were nasty. I didn't even attempt to go in the breakfast room, although other people that stayed there said it was gross. It isn't even that close to the cruise ship ports. Stay in Old San Juan much nicer and much closer.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the short stop...”
Reviews.Author: CRZDVA
Reviews.Content: There were 5 of us...3 in one room and 2 in the other. We stayed at this hotel before our Cruise. It was a tiny tiny room but we were only in Puerto Rico for 2nights/2days. The only time we were at the hotel was to change and sleep. We were on a tight budget and this certainly helped us stay under it. The beach is right there 100 feet away. People there were cortious enough.. My friends and I had no complaints... Would we stay here again?...maybe not if we are staying for a longer time...not enough space for a group with lots of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Fun In The Sun”
Reviews.Author: 05Fatboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Canario By the Sea from Feb 13th -20th. MY brother had stayed at this hotel before. He really liked it, said its nothing fancy, but it is clean & close to the beach. I was alittle concerned about the hotel-no pool etc.,but when we arrived I was very pleased, first with the location (just steps away from the beach), to the cleanliness & then to the very friendly staff! Who needs a pool when you have a beautiful beach right outside your door. Yes, the room may have been alittle small, but who sits in their room on beautiful sunny days in Puerto Rico. The beds were comfortable & the shower was really nice. We loved the location also. I really enjoyed my stay here & definately would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark M
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at El Canario by the Sea for the first time in 2004. We came back this year with my sister and brother-in-law and shared room 300 on the third floor. It is a very clean and basic hotel that cannot be beat. The location is excellent: Steps to the beach and Ashford Avenue (a Walgreens is less than a block away); the staff members are warm and friendly; and the price is great. We loved waking in the morning and having both Puerto Rican and American coffee, a variety of rolls and pastries, juice, bananas, cereals, and bread and jams, all served downstairs in a lovely courtyard. The beds are comfortable and each room has a window air-conditioner. Above all, everything is clean, clean, clean.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right For The Money”
Reviews.Author: mari74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went there for a weekend to celebrate our 1st year annivesary...yes its not the Hilton, however we just wanted a bed to sleep in and a place to come to when we were just to tired of viewing the island. If you plan on staying in your room, then Yes go for the Hilton or the Marriott, however if you want to save money for those delicious piña coladas and gas, then this hotel is just fine. The rooms are a little small, who cares,bed was fine they have breakfast in the morning which I thougth was nice and the beach is literly only steps away which was also nice...by the way location, location, location it is right in the middle of el condado...it's worth every penny...

Reviews.Title: “Its really El Canario by the Sea Behind a Big Building”
Reviews.Author: qkadwani
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before moving to the Marriott. The stay was fine considering that we were sightseeing in Old San Juan for the day and then going to the beach. Dont rent this hotel if you plan on relaxing in it because there's no view of the beach/ocean, very little light comes in and its behind a huge, tall building. Its only good for the bed and the locale. Right on Ashford Ave in Condado and $15 ride to Old San Juan and the airport. My advice? Spend $100 more and stay at the Marriot right next door, thats worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Expect Anything Special”
Reviews.Author: TejasTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed there three days with a friend and everything was fine until the last day. Our toilet did not flush and we contacted the person at the front desk who told us to go get the plunger across the hallway. We walked across the hallway and didn't find a plunger. We told the person at the front desk this and said that we would be out for the next few hours and that they could come into the room to fix the toilet. When we came back, we asked if our toilet had been fixed and the guy at the front desk said that it was still not fixed but that he had called the manager. They then came to our room later that night to give us the plunger. Then left us to fix it ourselves. No manager came. No repair person came. Just the same person at the front desk. Since this was late at night and we were leaving in the morning, we decided to just tell the manager in the morning that the toilet was not fixed. When we told the manager about how unhappy we were about our room that night, she said that we should have told them that the toilet was not fixed (we did more than 5 different times that night) and that it was OUR fault for not asking for another room. All we wanted was an apology for the inconvenience. This place is ok if you don't mind the loud noise from others in the hotels, the strong smell of bleach everywhere, and substandard service. For twenty more dollars, you should try to stay at one of the other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Trade location for quality”
Reviews.Author: Britishinmyheart
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the El Canario in San Juan for three days and had a wonderful time. The hotel is centrally located and within walking distance of many shops, restaurants, and attractions. We were literally a few steps from a gorgeous beach with very few tourists. The neighborhood was safe and clean. There was a decent continental breakfast with fruit and some excellent pastry. That being said, the rooms were below par. The walls were paper thin and my children were exposed to very profane noises coming from the honeymooners in the next room. The view from the lobby is of the ocean but the view from our room was an alley and a seedy apartment building. I would recommend this hotel to younger couples or singles due to the downtown location and the questionable occupants.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Safe and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: CirqueGirl
Reviews.Content: El Canario by the Sea is just that, a few steps from the beach. The front desk clerk allowed me to check in right around 11:00 when I arrived. I definitely appreciated that since I was tired from traveling and had just arrived on an early morning flight. As soon as housekeeping had the room cleaned up I was allowed to check-in. The elevator was being repaired and I voiced concerns about lugging a 43 pound bag upstairs. He gave me a room on the first floor, eliminated that problem, but I was concerned with lobby noise or patio noise. This hotel was quiet during the day and at night. I slept wonderfully sound and I felt safe. Very basic amenities, but enjoyed the location and the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Expect Four Stars”
Reviews.Author: srafnel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at El Canario with my mother for the weekend of March 29-April 2. The hotel was exactly what I expected. Yes, it has its bad points: -Age: It is an older hotel, and it shows. The rooms are outdated and open to outdoor hallways surrounding a courtyard. -Size: The rooms are small, and the bathrooms are cramped. -Breakfast: Limited options. If you are planning on using the breakfast as a full meal, forget it. For a cup of coffee and a pastry, it is perfect. -Insects: We saw a few palmetto bugs, but this is a tropical location. The bugs disappeared after the first night and we never saw them again. However, the plusses outweighed the minuses for me: -Price: About $200 cheaper than nearby hotels -Location: The beach is just steps from the door. It is in the middle of Condado with shops, restaurants, and a bus line to Old San Juan within 3 blocks. -Staff: The second shift staff was FANTASTIC. They were able to book a snorkeling excursion for us and reccommend the best ways to go to Old San Juan (the bus), the Bacardi Factory (the ferry and a publico), and El Yunque (car rental on Ashford Avenue). Add to that, they were very friendly and seemed to recognize everyone staying in the hotel (a plus for security!). In summary: This is a fine place to stay. If you expect a luxury experience, you will be disappointed. If you are on a budget and do not mind an older hotel (with its inherent problems) you will enjoy El Canario.

Reviews.Title: “It smelled horrably”
Reviews.Author: akurmang
Reviews.Content: It is right next to the beach as promised, but we had to go buy a bottle of Feabreaze to spray the room as it smelled so bad. The stairway smelled like chlorine the whole time we were there. And you can hear every single noise in neighboring rooms. If I could make the decision over I would have never stayed there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice and quaint - close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: quincey1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at El Canario By The Sea from March 28 to April 1 with a group of friends. When I originally booked the dates I was a little aprehensive as I was going on the good word of other people on this site, but after talking directly to the management at the hotel I was convinced. When we arrived our check in was handled politely and quickly so we could settle in and start enjoying San Juan. The breakfast was satisfactory and simple, but the staff kept things neat and tidy and always politely answered any questions. The rooms were clean and bug free (not an easy task I imagine in a tropical country). If I could make one suggestion to the hotel it would be to update the rooms as they have the lobby. The hotel's site says that it is across the street from the beach, but it is practically ON THE BEACH!!! The sound of the wind and the waves was loud but lulled us to sleep every night (which wasn't hard after days of discovering San Juan and Old San Juan). If you get a chance check out the pizza/deli just up the street from Walgreens on Dr Ashford Ave across from a clothing store and beside a Mexican place - it is the BEST we have ever had! Paula - Canada

Reviews.Title: “San Juan for the weekend”
Reviews.Author: SJQ
Reviews.Content: Needed to find a not so pricey room for the weekend of Feb 24th to attend my sons college (medical school) HOORAY!! graduation held in Bayamon which is 10 miles fron San Juan. Let me add that cab fare to graduation was $30.00 1 way. YIKES!! I had read several reviews and was somewhat skeptical. This hotel was fine. No, it's not the hilton nor marriott but a holiday inn type room.The staff was very friendly and helpful to me. Housekeeping was great. Even saw the housekeepers cleaning every wall of the elevator. Cab fare from airport was $15.00 plus .50 per bag. Cab fare from hotel to old San Juan was $12.00 Bus # B21 was .75 to Old San Jaun. when leaving Old San Juan anyone will point you the way to the bus terminal to get back to your hotel. If I went back to San Juan again i would stay at El Canario By The Sea.

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 with older hotel charm”
Reviews.Author: readytogoSoOregon
Reviews.Content: We chose this motel because it was reasonably priced ($134) and not far from Old San Juan and the pier for our cruise ship. This was not a room you would want to spend much time in; very small, no comfortable chair, tiny portable TV, noisy air conditioner, but it was not dirty. We never could get the safe to work. Our friends' room was better all the way around although price was the same. I was kept awake the first night by a screaming woman. The next morning we found she lives there and just goes off occasionally. There was a lot of construction going on in the area, so there was that noise as well. The beach was about 100 feet away, but we were advised that it was not safe because of the winter surf. There were only a few surfers on the beach. The continental breakfast consisted of cereal, rolls, fruit and juices. Good, but no protein. The patio was small and thankfully walled which helped soften the noise. The location was convenient, with the bus stop being only a block away. The fare to Old San Juan was only $.75 and even less for seniors. At age 75 you ride free! (Taxis were $12.) Within just a few blocks were the usual fast food places (Burger King, Wendy's, Baskin Robbins). Walgreens is just 2 blocks away and has a food section. I would stay there again if my plan was to sightsee all day and just sleep there. If you plan to spend much time in your room, this is not the place for you. El Canario by the Lagoon which is very close looked nicer and might be a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: SimonC,Toronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel, because it was the cheapest we could find! Most of the hotels in San Juan are quite expensive. Even this one was overpriced although it was the best deal we could find. The location of the hotel in Condado is just steps from the beach, although in hindsight I would have preferred to stay in Old San Juan as it has more character and is more interesting. The room was really nothing special and, although the door didn't seem to lock securely from the outside. The staff were reasonably nice, although when we checked out they tried to charge us for calls that we made from our room which just had a busy signal! I refused to pay these charges. Overall, the hotel was nothing special - just a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Close to bus stop, taxis, Walgreens, beach. Clean, safe, comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: prOakland
Reviews.Content: Breakfast is included. It was on the patio from 7am-10am. There was milk, orange juice, coffee, pastry, bananas. Free newpapers except on Sundays. The bus stop to Old San Juan was right around the corner, only a few steps away, a 30 second walk and cost only 75 cents. It seems to come every 45 minutes--no schedule. The last bus back from Old San Juan is 8pm. Take the B21 bus to and from Old San Juan. Once in Old San Juan, take the free green trolley. It stops in front of both San Cristobal and El Morro forts. It also goes all around town. The town has Wendy's, McDonalds, Walgreens as well as lots of restaurants and shops. The trolley seemed to pass by every 10 minutes. There are always taxis hanging right outside, across the street. The area felt safe because they were there, even at night and even at 7am on New Year's Day. There was construction next door, so there was a guard on the sidewalk next to our hotel. I went with my 2 teenage daughters on (12/30 to 1/1) New Year's Eve and we felt safe at all times. Restaurants closed before 9:30pm on New Year's Eve, but there was always Walgreens across the street. There is a food mart inside of Walgreens. And you can use the microwave in the lobby. The room had no bugs. They don't allow food in the rooms, so we didn't see any roaches. We were on the 3rd floor. It was clean, the water pressure was ok, hot water was ok. It was noisy. The safety deposit box takes pushing with your foot at the same time pulling the key with your hand. If you don't give up, the safety deposit box DOES work.

Reviews.Title: “Infested and bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: Rizzie_02
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 4 days 3 nights after finding that the Marriot was completely booked. It had to be my worst experience ever in a hotel. There were roaches crawling in the clock as well as on the bed, when I aproached the front desk with this information they apperared very nonchalant as if this happens all the time. He stated he would call the manager and let me know what he could when she called back. After speaking with the second person at the front desk later that night they told me they could change my room assignment. I went to look at the second room and there were roaches in the bathroom. The person at the front desk informed me that maybe the second floor was infested(both rooms were located on this floor). So I was then told to look at a room on the third floor. (It was 10:30pm on a Friday night and there were no rooms available at the surrounding hotels) This one was okay and the front desk personnel changed me to this room and told me to speak with the manager in the morning, he warned me that she was awful with customer service and he was right this was the worst experience with customer service I had ever seen. The manager had a thousand excuses why there were roaches in the room (i.e. other guest brought them, this is the carribean what do you expect, etc.). She informed me that all hotels had roaches and it was no reason to be upset. She was very rude, hostile and unprofessional. And to top it off she began making smart comments about the situation to guest checking out, as if it was a laughing matter. She did give me a 10% discount for 2 of the 3 nights I stayed (she stated she would not give a discount for the third night because I did not see roaches that night, just baby lizards in the room). All and all spend the extra money to stay at the marriot and book early they fill up fast. Maybe the other Canario hotels are better I can only judge this particular hotel's customer service. Also the hotel is pretty nasty and needs some major repairs. The good thing is that it is steps from the beach, but I would rather walk blocks than to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “It wasn't horrible”
Reviews.Author: Travel-n-Buppie
Reviews.Content: I read almost every review before I left for my trip. But I went against the reviews and decided to stay there anyway, I need to see for myself. I stayed for one night before my cruise, and I paid less than a hundred dollars. The room was so tiny, the bathroom was almost non exsistant and I took a shower with my filp-flops on. It was what I expected, based on the previous reviews. The area is an up and coming area in San Juan. The beach is extremely close and beautiful. The area is nice, going thru a renavation though. In a few years it will be hard to get a room here, because of all the new hotels and resorts they are building in the nearby areas (within walking distance). Old San Juan is really close, either a $.75 bus ride or a $12 cab ride. Old San Juan is nice, lively on the weekend, especialy on Sundays. I stayed in the Sheraton in Old San Juan after the cruise ( I wrote a review there as well). If you are staying for a night or two, I think it is worth the money. And if you just plan to use your room as somewhere to sleep then it is not that bad. If you like the luxury of the a nice room as part of your vacation, then I would not recommend it. The worst part of this whole El Canario Inn/Sea stay was that I orginally reserved my room at the "Inn" and when I called to confrim my resevation two days before my arrival, I was told that my resevation was moved to the "sea." The "Inn" was closed for vacation. And no one contacted me about the move. I am glad I called. AND when I wanted to cancel my reservation at the "Inn" for after my cruise, I wasn't able to do it at the "Sea" I had to wait and do it myself when they opened.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Stevemac113
Reviews.Content: I guess the big selling point of El Canario is that it's a stones throw from the beach. Is that worth over $100/ night? Not to me. The room was cramped and stuffy and the bed was uncomfortable. There are better accomidations a few blocks inland for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Bare bones hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimc64
Reviews.Content: We had no idea what to expect when we arrived. The hotel is within steps of the beach, but is pretty minimal. We had a small room with sparse furnishings with no view (except of the wall of the building next door), a tiny bathroom that had been patched together, a toilet that was so close to the wall that you had to sit sideways, and packages of cheap shampoo and soap. The air conditioner worked - which you need to have because of the humidity. The hotel staff was very, very friendly. I am used to higher room standards for a hotel that costs $129 a night, but have heard that this is pretty typical for Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Place and Budget Quality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staying here after looking at their internet site was a disappointment. Yes, it's close to the beach. The breakfast is edible, but I won't go back. I was trying to stay not too far from the airport and ended up being very sorry not to be in Old San Juan. I think internet sites should not lead you to believe a place is nicer than it is.

Reviews.Title: “Best Price, and on the beach”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinVagabond
Reviews.Content: This was the most inexpensive hotel in the Condado beach area that had acceptable reviews on TripAdvisor. For our Dec. 8-11, 2005 stay, we paid the [--] Internet rate of $80, plus $3/day Energy Charge, 9% tax, and $2/day for room safe key. It was clean, and well located. There is only one condo building between this hotel and the beach, but that tall building blocks the ocean view from all rooms except those on the front of the hotel ($90). Our room was somewhat small, but adequate. The continental breakfast in the courtyard offered abundant sweetrolls, muffins, bananas, coffee and fruit juice. Our credit card was not charged until checkout. Limited overnight parking on the street in front of hotel. The only downside of this place is that there is no luggage storage room for pre-checkin post-checkout. You are to leave your bags sitting in a lobby room, which all guests pass through going to and from their rooms. Although it is next to the front desk, the receptionist can not see into the room to watch the bags. A sign says you can leave bags there, but they are not responsible. We would stay here again. FYI - there is a cheap Internet cafe about 1/2 block north of the hotel on Ave. Ashford.

Reviews.Title: “It's Okay!”
Reviews.Author: phatloufunk
Reviews.Content: So if you want a mediocre stay at a decent price, stay here. However don't expect too much. The buildings around this place are falling apart and the smells of sewage aren't too far. However the cost of the place (for being near the beach) was ~ 85-90$. We stayed one night, the hotel has decent wear and tear and is obvious. The beach isn't too lovely this time of year. Pretty much Ashford wasn't too great this time at all.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my husband and i decided to stay here for one day. We loved it so much that we ended staying there for 3 days. It very affordable. very clean, professional staff, very nice continental breakfast every morning with free newspaper. next year when we return to puerto rico , we will be staying at the canario by the sea again. i recommend this place. its also located near casinos and the beach is approx. 15 steps .

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is a average bed and breakfast with a great location to the beach and close to all the attractions in the city. If you are looking for luxury don't stay here. We all loved it and the service was great. puertoricanbizzifreckles.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: MsMommy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here pre-cruise for a honeymoon in 2004 for one night and would definitely not stay here again. There was a lage gap between the bottom of our door and the floor which allowed plenty of large lizards in. I live in Florida so I am used to seeing them inside occasionally, but they were able to come in and out so frequently that we ended up putting towels under the door. As reported before the bathrooms were very tiny and I just did not want to put my things down anywhere because it didn't feel clean. "Breakfast" was some measly continental left outside in subtopical weather in the courtyard for guests to graze...(and probably those lizards and cats too) I would not call this breakfast at all. My standards are not all that high. We travel frequently on a budget and this was far below my standard for a Motel 6 at $40 bucks a night...and definitely a complete letdown at over $100. It truly is worth the extra few dollars to go to a chain for a more comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “A little suggestion”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, a block away from the beach. Just a little tip....don't rely on the operator for the morning call, because they completely forgot to wake me up. Thank god, I set my watch alarm....or else I would have missed my flight back home. And when I called the operator to tell him that had he forgot to wake me up, he gave some stupid reason ...like it was raining that's why he forgot. Didn't even say sorry. I also told the front desk, and they just laughed. Oh well....

Reviews.Title: “better than i thought”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ok. so the rooms are VERY basic. and the a/c noisy (they add a $3 night electricity charge for it too). but you got to give the place credit for decent service -- and a location two steps away from the beach (don't expect to see it from the room though). the nicest part was the day we left -- they let us use a small shower room on the first floor after coming back from the beach and before the flight home -- even though we checked out hours before.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for those wishing to experience San Juan and Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a 5 day stay at El Canario by the Sea, and we were very pleased with our experience. The main thing to keep in mind is that El Canario hotels are NOT resort hotels. If you are looking to spend lots of money to lay by a pool all day, this is not the hotel for you. If you are on a budget and looking for a clean, comfortable room right on the beach that offers free breakfast (the pastries were AWESOME!) and a friendly and helpful staff, El Canario is a great choice. The best way to summarize our experience is that I felt like I was a guest in someone's house instead of a nameless guest in a chain hotel. The building is an older building that has been tastefully decorated in tropical decor. The rooms are simple and comfortable. The courtyard where they serve breakfast is really beautiful, so be sure to check it out. And best of all, you are about 10 steps from Conado Beach. And although the hotel's site says they do not have ocean view rooms, the rooms on the front of the building all DO have views of the ocean. The staff, especially Karlos, was wonderful! We had so many questions about tours, restaurants, and just getting around. Karlos helped us so much in ensuring we knew where to go. Thanks Karlos! I have never experienced such personal service and attention from a chain hotel, and good service makes a world of difference! The only real issues we experienced were a drippy faucet in our shower and a broken window latch (issues you'll face in older buildings) and some noise on the weekend nights. The hotel is located on a public access road to the beach so you get some street noise on Friday and Saturday nights (especially if you are one of the front rooms), but this was not an issue the weekday nights. Unfortunately, that's a catch of being so close to a beautiful beach. Bottom line, I'd definitely stay there again! Like I said, if you are looking to lounge at a hotel, not a good choice. If you are looking to get out and see Puerto Rico (and I STRONGLY recommend getting out of San Juan and exploring the island), this is a great place to stay, and it is convenient to restaurants, a convenient, and a bus stop. By the way, if you are looking for good Puerto Rican food, try Cafe de Angel which is about two blocks from the hotel. It's fabulous! Ajili-Mojili (about 4 blocks away) is a little more expensive, but also wonderful. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Only thing consisitent - was inconsistencies”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On 2/25/05 - my partner and myself with a group of friends were booked to stay at the El Canario by The Sea for 4 nights- we only ended up staying for 2. We are a very easy crowd to please- and just go with the flow- but to be on vacation to celebrate my 40th and feel like we entered a stressful situation was not a good thing. Before considering your stay - please take note-- communication between staff and clientel was lacking and innapproiate. When asking for more pillows - we were told no- when asking for a blanket- beware- none on the beds- just a top sheet - we were told no- some rooms had remotes- some didn't- some rooms had cups in bathroom to rinse mouth out after brushing-some didn't - at times room towels and washcloths were not available- when we wanted ice- we were yelled out for taking too much- when we took extra milk other than enough to fill bowl of cereal- we were chased down and treated like children- sometimes beach towels were not available- the elevator never worked properly- always ended up either below or above floor exit- very dangerous- when we advised the staff of this problem- they shrugged their shoulders and said- well if you get hurt and sue us- we will sue the elevator company- now is that way to resopond to hotel guests. Some rooms had clock radio's - some didin't .Stray cats surrounded the hotel- so the smell of cat urine was not pleasant- and if staying in room 308- be prepared to hear screaming cats in heat - jumping from roof to roof in the wee hours of the morning. If you are in room 206 - two single beds- expect to have your knees hitting your chin while on the tiolet- very very small bathroom. Room 206 had great water pressure- but 300-308-and 200 was a bit lacking with water pressure and hot water. Bottom line is any time we asked for something or were concerned with an issue- we were simply treated as if they didn't need the business. By day 2 - we went across the street to the Marriott- and booked 4 rooms for the rest of the stay. Before we left for vacation we did look at the Marriott property- but a steep price of $400 a night kept us away- when we checked the second time around when we were in town $200 a night was the price for a nights stay- only $75 more than El Canario and well worth the difference. So think hard- treat yourself to the comforts that you would want on vacation. Always good to add the positive: rooms very clean- air conditioning units pumped cold air- try the italian bread at breakfast- very fresh

Reviews.Title: “good deal great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 8 of us stayed there jan7 prior to our cruise. I didn't find the hotel rundown at all as stated by one reviewer. It was clean, inexpensive andclose to the beach and was within walking distance to some inexpensive outdoor eating establishments with live music,casino(across the street)and Pizza hut and subway for those on a real budget. Our other 4 friends stayed at the Normandie,paid 3 times as much and were very disappointed. They even tried to switch to our hotel, but it was sold out. Also the continental breakfast was nice. If you go in knowing this is not the Ritz for the money and location, I feel it was a good deal and would stay there again. Also the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel!!! I stayed there during 4th of July weekend and it was great. It's a small hotel, and that's good because the staff get to know you and are extremely helpful. One of the workers there knew EVERYTHING there was to do, and the cheapest way to get to it. He was our own tour guide. The complaints people have are ridiculous, this hotel wasn't the Wyndham, but it was clean, comfortable, safe, and affordable. Besides, who goes to Puerto Rico to spend most of their time in a hotel when you're only 20 steps from the beach!!!! Also, I won $3000 my last night there in the casino diagnal from the hotel while playing slots. It was a GOOD TRIP.

Reviews.Title: “On a Budget? Then this is your place.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you're just looking for a clean, convenient place to lay your head at night, a great breakfast, and would rather spend your money on seeing Puerto Rico rather than blowing it all on a hotel, then this is the place for you. This was my third time visiting Puerto Rico. I usually stay at the Ramada San Juan, but this time I needed something a little cheaper, so I chose El Canario by the Sea. The front desk service was friendly, the continental breakfast was tasty, housekeeping was quick and thorough, and we were only steps away from a great part of Condado Beach and from the amazing restaurants and hotels where you could salsa dance the night away. But stay away from room #104, you hear every sound from the street and from the people in the hallways. Otherwise, it was a great place to lay my head at night for the price and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: sugrshack
Reviews.Content: Small hotel; they are at least honest; the view of the ocean is blocked by a large condominium. The staff is nice, but couldn't give much advice about nightlife. My room was a shoebox, and the only "view" was of a brick wall through the barred window. It wasn't really worth the $100 a night. The condado section is pretty horrible; kind of like the South Bronx in the summer... you are surrounded by burned out empty buildings. You are also warned not to go onto the beach after dark (dangerous, with roaming gangs). .. not what I hope for when I'm trying to "get away." The only thing to do after dark is gamble at some the nearby hotels. As for things to do, Old San Juan is nice, but a long bus ride from the hotel, and very very very expensive. I learned why this city is worth maybe one day on a Cruise stop, but not as a location. If you're going to Puerto Rico, I recommend not staying anywhere near San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Rating is too high.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not deserve the rating. It is fine for the price. It is clean, but small and run-down. The problem is the taxis line up for the Mariott across the street and the drivers honk and yell from early in the morning. If you want to stay ultra cheap, bring earplugs and this in your place.

Reviews.Title: “A++”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Exceptional. Everything about this hotel was just right and for a great price. Great location; right on the beach and closer to Old San Juan than the ritzier hotels of Isla Verde. Front desk was very helpful directing us and helping us with tours. Housekeeping; also great. They say on their website the rooms don't have a view and that was found to be very untrue about our room- right out the front window was the ocean. It was great. Feel free to email me if you're apprehensive about staying here.

HotelInfo.Name: Sandy Beach Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 4 Condado Avenue | Condado, San Juan 00907, Puerto Rico (Formerly El Canario by the Sea)
